## Exemplo de um diagrama de cordas

```{R}
v1 <- c(rep("F", 4), rep("M", 5), "F", "M")
v2 <- c('I', 'I', 'B', 'I', 'B', 'P', 'B', 'R', 'B', 'I', 'R')

length(v1)
length(v2)

require(circlize)

m <- data.frame(table(v1,v2))

par(cex = 3, mar = c(0, 0, 0, 0))
chordDiagram(m,
             col = rainbow(6),
             annotationTrackHeight = mm_h(c(3,3)),
             annotationTrack = c("name", "grid"),
             grid.border = "Black",
             diffHeight = mm_h(5))
```

## Gr치fico de Bolhas

```{R}
x <- c(10, 20, 15, 20, 40)
y <- c(1, 4, 5, 1, 5)
z <- c(41, 22, 20, 11, 50)
rotulos <- c("A", "A", "A", "B", "B")
cc <- c(2, 2, 2, 3, 3)

symbols(x = x,
        y = y,
        circles = z,
        inches = 0.3,
        bg = cc)

text(x, y, rotulos, cex = 2)

legend(30,
       2,
       c("cat1", "cat2"),
       pch = 19,
       cex = 1.5,
       col = c(2,3),
       box.col = NA)
```

## Gr치fico de Barras

```{R}
ano <- c(rep(2023, 12), rep(2023, 12))
mes <- 1:12
ven <- rpois(24,10)

cores <- c("#299437", "#ab54b0")

dados <- rbind(ven[1:12], ven[13:24])
soma <- apply(dados, 2, sum) #2= por coluna

multipl_matrizes <- dados %*% diag(1/soma)

## Barras conjuntas
barplot(multipl_matrizes,
        names.arg = mes,
        col = cores,
        border = F)

## Barras alinhadas
## agora com besides
barplot(dados,
        beside = T,
        names.arg = mes,
        col = cores,
        border = F)
```
